terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Have you wished you were dead or wished you could go to sleep and not wake up?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Description of wishing to be dead.
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Description of Wish to be Dead

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Have you actually had any thoughts of killing yourself?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Non-Specific Suicidal Thought

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Description of non-specific active suicidal thoughts.
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Description of Non-Specific Suicide Thought

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Have you been thinking about how you might do this?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Suicidal Ideation-No Intent

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Description of active suicidal ideation with any methods (not plan) without intent to act.
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Description of Suicidal Ideation-No Intent

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Have you have these thoughts and had some intention of acting on them?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Ideation With Intent, No Plan

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Description of active suicidal ideation with some intent to act, without specific plan.
terms.preferredTerm: CSS01-Ideation With Intent No Plan Descr
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Description of Ideation With Intent, No Plan

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Have you started to work out or worked out the details of how to kill yourself? Do you intend to carry out this plan?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Ideation With Plan/Intent

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Description of active suicidal ideation with specific plan and intent.
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Description of Ideation With Plan and Intent

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Most severe ideation.
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Most Severe Ideation

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Description of most severe ideation.
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Describe Most Severe Ideation

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - How many times have you had these thoughts?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Frequency of Most Severe Ideation

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - When you have these thoughts, how long do they last?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Duration of Most Severe Ideation

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Could/can you stop thinking about killing yourself or wanting to die if you want to?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Control over Most Severe Ideation

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Are there things - anyone or anything (e.g., family, religion, pain of death) - that stopped you from wanting to die or acting on thoughts of committing suicide?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Deterrents to Most Severe Ideation

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - What sort of reasons did you have for thinking about wanting to die or killing yourself? Was it to end the pain or stop the way you were feeling (in other words you couldn't go on living with this pain or how you were feeling) or was it to get attention, revenge or a reaction from others? Or both?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Reasons for Most Severe Ideation

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Have you made a suicide attempt? Have you done anything to harm yourself? Have you done anything dangerous where you could have died?
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Actual Suicide Attempt

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Total number of actual attempts.
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Number of Actual Suicide Attempts

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Description of actual attempt.
terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Description of Actual Suicide Attempts

terms.submissionValue: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline Test Name
synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Non-suicidal Self-injurious Behavior

terms.definition: Columbia-Suicidality Severity Rating Scale Baseline - Has there been a time when you started to do something to try to end your life but someone or something stopped you before you actually did anything?

synonyms: C-SSRS Baseline - Interrupted Suicide Attempt

codelists.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale test name.
codelists.name: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
codelists.preferredTerm: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
codelists.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: CDISC Questionnaire AIMS Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Muscles of facial expression, e.g., movements of forehead, eyebrows, periorbital area, cheeks. Include frowning, blinking, grimacing of upper face.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Muscles of Facial Expression

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Lips and perioral area, e.g., puckering, pouting, smacking.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Lips and Perioral Area

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Jaw, e.g., biting, clenching, chewing, mouth opening, lateral movement.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Jaw

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Tongue. Rate only increase in movement both in and out of mouth, not inability to sustain movement.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Tongue

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Extremity Movements, Upper (arms, wrists, hands, fingers). Include movements that are choreic (rapid, objectively purposeless, irregular, spontaneous) or athetoid (slow, irregular, complex, serpentine). Do not include tremor (repetitive, regular, rhythmic movements).
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Upper Extremities

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Extremity Movements, Lower (legs, knees, ankles, toes), e.g., lateral knee movement, foot tapping, heel dropping, foot squirming, inversion and eversion of foot.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Lower Extremities

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Trunk Movements, Neck, shoulders, hips, e.g., rocking, twisting, squirming, pelvic gyrations. Include diaphragmatic movements.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Neck, Shoulders, Hips

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Global Judgments, Severity of abnormal movements, based on the highest single score on the above items.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Severity of Abnormal Movements

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Global Judgments, Incapacitation due to abnormal movements.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Incapacitation Due to Abnormal Movements

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Global Judgments, Patient's awareness of abnormal movements.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Patient's Awareness of Abnormal Movements

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Dental Status, Current problems with teeth and/or dentures.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Current Teeth/Dentures Problems

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Dental Status, Does patient usually wear dentures?
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name
synonyms: AIMS - Patient Usually Wears Dentures

terms.definition: International Index of Erectile Function - Over the past four weeks how often were you able to get an erection during sexual activity?

codelists.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale test name.
codelists.name: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
codelists.preferredTerm: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
codelists.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: CDISC Questionnaire NPS Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Please use the scale below to tell us how intense your pain is.
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-Tell Us How Intense Your Pain Is
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Tell Us How Intense Your Pain Is

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Please use the scale below to tell us how sharp your pain feels. Words used to describe 'sharp' feelings include 'like a knife,' 'like a spike,' 'jabbing,' or 'like jolts.'
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-Tell Us How Sharp Your Pain Feels
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Tell Us How Sharp Your Pain Feels

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Please use the scale below to tell us how hot your pain feels. Words used to describe very hot pain include 'burning' and 'on fire.'
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-Tell Us How Hot Your Pain Feels
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Tell Us How Hot Your Pain Feels

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Please use the scale below to tell us how dull your pain feels. Words used to describe very dull pain include 'like a dull toothache,' 'dull pain,' and 'like a bruise.'
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-Tell Us How Dull Your Pain Feels
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Tell Us How Dull Your Pain Feels

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Please use the scale below to tell us how cold your pain feels. Words used to describe very cold pain included 'like ice' and 'freezing.'
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-Tell Us How Cold Your Pain Feels
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Tell Us How Cold Your Pain Feels

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Please use the scale below to tell us how sensitive your skin is to light touch or clothing. Words used to describe sensitive skin include 'like sunburned skin,' and 'raw skin.'
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Tell Us How Sensitive Your Skin is to Light Touch or Clothing

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Please use the scale below to tell us how itchy your pain feels. Words used to describe itchy pain include 'like poison oak' and 'like a mosquito bite.'
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-Tell Us How Itchy Your Pain Feels
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Tell Us How Itchy Your Pain Feels

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Which of the following best describes the time quality of your pain? Please check only one answer.
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-Describe Time Quality Of Your Pain
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Describe the Time Quality Of Your Pain

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - I feel a background pain all of the time and occasional flare-ups (break-through pain) some of the time. Describe the background pain.
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Describe the Background Pain

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - I feel a background pain all of the time and occasional flare-ups (break-through pain) some of the time. Describe the flare-up (break-through) pain.
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Describe the Flare-up Pain

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - I feel a single type of pain all the time. Describe this pain.
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-Describe Single Type Pain All Time
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Describe the Single Type of Pain All Time

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - I fee a single type of pain only sometimes. Other times, I am pain free. Describe the occasional pain.
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Describe the Occasional Pain

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Now that you have told us the different physical aspects of your pain, the different types of sensations, we want you to tell us overall how unpleasant your pain is to you. Words used to describe very unpleasant pain include 'miserable' and intolerable.' Remember, pain can have a low intensity, buy still feel extremely unpleasant, and some kinds of pain can have a high intensity but be very tolerable. With this scale, please tell us how unpleasant your pain feels.
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-Tell How Unpleasant Your Pain Feel
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - Tell Us Overall How Unpleasant Your Pain is to You

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Lastly, we want you to give us an estimate of the severity of your deep versus surface pain. We want your to rate each location of pain separately. We realize that it can be difficult to make these estimates, and most likely it will be a 'best guess,' but please give us your best estimate. How intense is your deep pain?
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-How Intense is Your Deep Pain
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - How Intense is Your Deep Pain

terms.definition: Neuropathic Pain Scale - Lastly, we want you to give us an estimate of the severity of your deep versus surface pain. We want your to rate each location of pain separately. We realize that it can be difficult to make these estimates, and most likely it will be a 'best guess,' but please give us your best estimate. How intense is your surface pain?
terms.preferredTerm: NPS01-How Intense is Your Surface Pain
terms.submissionValue: Neuropathic Pain Scale Questionnaire Test Name
synonyms: NPS - How Intense is Your Surface Pain
